sources.name: Hudson frames Sanofi as 'R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company'
sources.notes: Hudson frames Sanofi as 'R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company'

sources.name: ROAI (Return on AI Investment) framework introduced
sources.notes: ROAI (Return on AI Investment) framework introduced

summary: Hudson frames Sanofi as 'R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company': CEO Paul Hudson described Sanofi's strategic identity as an 'R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company' during Q4 2025 results. This framing elevates AI from a tool to a core identity claim, consistent ROAI (Return on AI Investment) framework introduced: Hudson published a STAT article introducing ROAI as a measurement framework for AI value. The article notes 95% of AI pilot projects fail (citing MIT), positioning Sanofi as moving beyond pilots. Full Opella divestiture completed, reinvestment in AI and M&A: The completion of the Opella consumer health transaction enabled reinvestment into business development and M&A. Combined with a 5 billion euro share buyback, this represents strategic portfolio simpl
